negotiation_message: Alice said in round 1: Hi Oliver, nice to meet you! Since there are 2 books, 1 hat, and 3 balls in total, I was thinking maybe a fair split would be for me to take the hat and 1 ball, while you take the 2 books and 2 balls. What do you think about that proposal?
oliver replied in round 1: How about we reverse the deal?

Alice said in round 2: Hmm, I'd prefer not to simply reverse the deal as I think the hat is a bit more valuable than the books and balls. How about a compromise - what if I take the hat and 1 book, and you can have the other book and all 3 balls? That way we each get a variety of items.
oliver replied in round 2: How valuable is the hat? It's extremeley valuable for me as well? Can I take the hat, while you can take the rest?

Alice said in round 3: The hat is quite valuable to me as well. I'd really prefer to keep the hat if possible. How about this - I'll take the hat and you can have everything else - both books and all 3 balls. That way you get 5 items total which is the majority. I think that's a fair compromise since the hat means a lot to me. Let me know what you think.
oliver replied in round 3: The hat really is that important to me too...still I'd like to take the reverse deal...

Alice said in round 4: Oliver, I understand the hat is very valuable to you, but it's also extremely important to me which is why I've been trying to find a fair compromise where I can keep the hat. Getting 5 out of the 6 items, including both books and all the balls, seems quite generous on my part. I'm afraid I can't agree to a complete reverse of my original offer as the hat is just too meaningful for me to give up. If you really feel you need the hat, then I propose we each just keep the items that matter most to us - I'll take only the hat, and you can have everything else. That's the best I can do. Let me know if you can agree to that, otherwise I think we may just be too far apart to make a deal work.
oliver replied in round 4: Truth be told, the hat is worth many more for me than the rest of the items combined

Alice said in round 5: 
Oliver, if the hat is truly worth that much more to you than all the other items combined, then it seems we may have a hard time finding a satisfactory agreement since the hat is also very valuable to me. I've offered you 5 of the 6 items, everything except the hat, which I feel is quite generous given my strong preference for the hat. 

However, if you feel you absolutely must have the hat and wouldn't be satisfied with all the books and balls instead, then I think the only reasonable solution is to not make a deal and for each of us to just walk away with no items. That wouldn't be my preference, as I'd rather we find an arrangement where we each get something that we value, but I just don't think I can part with the hat. The hat has too much sentimental value for me to concede it.

So let me know if you'd like to accept my previous offer of you getting both books and all 3 balls while I take just the hat. If not, then I think we'll have to agree to disagree and end our negotiation. Let me know your thoughts.
oliver replied in round 5: fine. you take the hat i take the rest

Alice said in round 6: 
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Oliver. Since the hat is so meaningful to both of us, I think this is the best solution - I'll take the hat that I cherish so much, and you'll get both books and all 3 balls, which is the majority of the items. 

Thank you for negotiating with me respectfully to find an outcome we can both live with, even if it wasn't either of our ideal scenarios. I'm glad we were able to come to an agreement in the end.

Given this resolution, let's conclude our negotiation. It was a pleasure working with you on this, Oliver.
oliver replied in round 6: halt negotiation
